body_html: @dustinvtran Thanks for your perspective. I agree that being able to switch among the different algorithms easily would be very helpful. Sometimes, users just want to approximate some tricky integral as part of a larger model and don't feel tied to any particular method for doing so. I was wondering if you could expand on what TF needs to add/change to be suitable as a probabilistic modeling language?
